author: ben_a_adams

Are we trying to lower requirements; rather than get back to some golden age?

Geth's 2022 requirements were 16GB RAM, 2TB drive

2 years on we are using just over 1TB; due mainly to old receipts and blocks, and you can buy a 4TB drive for less than a 2TB cost in 2022.

content: I care very little about validator requirements.  I care very much about end-user node operation requirements (so the GPU thing doesn't matter to me).

author: sky.cactus
content: How about 2018 then, that had a "similar" amount of active users according to your chart.  I would be more amenable to targeting that rather than 2022.

author: sky.cactus
content: I really think this whole debate can be reduced down to a disagreement about what the target demographic of an Ethereum client operator is.  Once Light Portal Network Clients are fully operational perhaps that can target the demographic I care about, while "full node" developers can focus on targeting validators.  Unfortunately, we aren't quite there yet with Portal Network and I feel like we should not add any *additional* growth until that is complete and fully integrated.  This would apply pressure to everyone to get Portal Network fully operational so they can have their gas limit increases.  If we give the gas limit increases first, I fear that we'll keep dragging our feet on Portal Network, state expiry, 4444, etc.

I'm not even saying increase the requirements; just pointing out we can do more on the 2022 requirements than we could do before (4444 is still very important though)
